website_summaries.verdict: Despite its powerful hardware, the R7500 doesn't have the performance and features to justify its premium price tag.
pros: The Netgear Nighthawk X4 AC2350 Smart Wi-Fi R7500 Router has powerful hardware, great Wi-Fi range, and a helpful QoS feature
When hosting a storage device, it becomes a robust home NAS server
cons: The router's Wi-Fi performance is significantly slower than its competitor, and its sluggish interface lacks in-depth customization and is bloated with too many menu items
The price is way too high for what the router has to offer

customer_reviews.title: CSR - Consistent, Solid & Reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a Linksys E2500, this was a remarkable upgrade and the difference were immediately noticeable. I will admit that the initial setup was quite hard, given the fact that I consider myself to be technologically literate. But I was impressed with Netgear's online tech support and they were able to help me with my issue. Beside this minor start-up issue, I noticed that the internet connection range was superb and I had no issues with internet drop-outs. Overall a very good product with a stellar customer support. Keep it up Netgear! You have convinced me to shift from Linksys camp over to yours!
customer_reviews.author: R. J

customer_reviews.title: They high jack you for customer service!!! JOKE
customer_reviews.text: This router worked great until the support expired after 90 days. They had one firmware update in that time. Now it won't work with my home security and you can't even email a question to support without paying $49 for support of pc and tablets and any other piece of equipment they currently don't sell but do not mention supporting their expensive routers. It appears to be setup to fail after the warranty time. How convenient. This company has the worst customer care plan I've ever seen. I guess I should've researched that first.
customer_reviews.author: birddog

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic support. No, not really.
customer_reviews.text: Bought on 11/26/15. Started using in April 2016. Worked super until last few days where download speed dropped 5 times less than usual. Had to reset the router. This happened a few more times. Contacted Netgear. Since i was past 90 day support, they offered to remote in for an obnoxious fee and extra support protection for a year. Seriously??? The community on their website talks about this issue a bunch. Constant dropping wifi speed. For the price of remote diagnistic check and year protection i will just buy another one. Different brand next time. Too bad. Used to really like Netgear
customer_reviews.author: VG

customer_reviews.title: 11ac AC box and it instantly increased the performance of all things connected to it due to better range. External antennae and
customer_reviews.text: In terms of performance, however, I moved from a Buffalo 802.11ac AC box and it instantly increased the performance of all things connected to it due to better range. External antennae and better construction help quite a lot. No restarts required yet either, contrary to some review complaints. As many have reported, the fact that this doesn't have manually configurable QoS for this price in kinda insane (this is why a point has been docked). Also the software is a bit outdated. Finally, this thing is HUGE, so make sure you have space for it.
customer_reviews.author: JerSpi

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy Extended Support For Replacement!
customer_reviews.text: Failed after 5 mons. Called Netgear support. They wanted 140.00 for telephone support. After much wasted time, they offered an additional 6 mons support for 89.00. What good is a product if the manufacturer doesn't offer support for a failure within 6 months after purchase. I will NEVER buy another NetGear product again... period. This is NOT how guarantees should work. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Just received this and set it up within 15 minutes. Was using an older router and this guy quadrupled my speeds, working at 2.4 ghz upstairs...router is in far corner of basement. When I brought my laptop into the room where the router is, speed was 10x what baseline was from old router speed. Love it. No lag downloading any longer...getting the xfinity speeds that I'm paying for. 1/1/16 After about two weeks, had similar problems of losing signal. My router was in an area kind of isolated in a far corner of the basement. Relocated centrally in basement and problems are gone. This thing is awesome!!!
customer_reviews.author: gasman94

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy, not very powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Not as strong as I was expecting. This is supposed to be their model with the best signal strength, but the generic Comcast router/modem we got with our internet access gives us about twice the signal strength and twice the throughput of this thing. Has a very long boot time. WPS connections are surprisingly hard to make, and it often re-boots with no wifi signal at all after making a WPS connection. The 4 antennae look impressive but don't seem to do much. If you leave it alone, it seems to mostly just work, but if you have to touch it for any reason, it's often an hour or two of troubleshooting before you have wifi again.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D. Anisman

customer_reviews.title: The second one is perfect and wonderful and everything I hoped it would be
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this router and was so upset that I spent so much money and I could not get it to work whatsoever. I am experienced with networking and had installed many routers, so I could not fathom why this one would not work for me. I finally conceded and exchanged it. Turns out, I had a defective one. The second one is perfect and wonderful and everything I hoped it would be. It allows all of our devices to connect without slowing anyone else down.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Huge cost for a huge piece of netgear
customer_reviews.text: I have to reboot this piece of netgear every single day. Don't waste your money or your time because the Technical support is terrible and nothing about this item is either easy or trust worthy. It's supposed to be very flexible and powerful but it has been nothing but a huge pain in my arse... Not to mention it is huge! I would rather piss on an electric fence than mess with this electronic device. I would never recommend anything from netgear to anyone nor would I recommend this to any of my enemies...
customer_reviews.author: Donald Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not for Comcast.
customer_reviews.text: This review is tricky. When this router worked for me, it worked extremely well. Unfortunately there is a well documented issue with Netgear routers not playing well with Comcast's (Xfinity's) IPV6 servers requiring regular reboots, that I didn't know about prior to ordering. I ended up ditching this an picking up an Asus RT AC-66U, choosing reliability over wifi speed. If you don't have Comcast, I highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S

customer_reviews.title: Nice router if you are a technical person, but don't count on support from Netgear.
customer_reviews.text: After a lot on internet searching I got this to work. There is an issue with Kaspersky not recognizing the router. I don't think this is Netgear's fault, but their support is terrible. The girl from somewhere overseas was very nice however could not solve my problem. The router does have good range and increased my Wifi bandwidth from 52Mbs to 380Mbs. I have had other issues too. I need to disconnect my DSL modem when I power the router on. If I don't the Netgear will not boot up The USB devices were not visible either. I don't know if this is a Windows 10, Kaspersky or Netgear issue, but I did find a solution on-line.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: WIFI disconnects too frequent.
customer_reviews.text: WIFI disconnects too frequent. The main reason i got this router was because my router from cable company disconnects too often. I thought this would fix my problem but the wifi connection also drops. look for other routers if you are looking for a reliable wifi router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great router, easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. convenient iphone and android app. the netgear software is OK, but limited. for most advanced features/set up, you'll need to launch the browser log in on a PC. Overall, very satisfied with this router. I love the ability to prioritize web traffic. However, the default settings will be applied. It would be good to go through all connected devices and set up your own. I haven't set up all features yet. Still need to establish guest access, attach back up drive, and the secure FTP website. Will update once completed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason McG

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but works great
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an old Linksys E4200. I needed range and better bandwidth for TV over wifi. I have a couple SiliconDust digital tuners in the house. The old router was struggling to keep up with the bandwidth demands. The Nighthawk X4 performs really well. The Dynamic QOS application works great to prioritize bandwidth to the device that needs it. The wireless N range is great. My connection was poor when I'm out in the garage. The cost of the router is a bit high. However, it does exactly what I wanted. It improved wireless N range and increased bandwidth of the router (not the ISP). AC range is great and fast. I have a NUC5i5RYH connected as well.
customer_reviews.author: ShutterBug

customer_reviews.title: This unit is great, has all the feature you would want in ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a network engineer by trade, so I have used hundreds of enterprise level routers and hundreds of home and small business routers. This unit is great, has all the feature you would want in a home or small/medium business, and the light deactivation switch is perfect for living room movie watching. The web interface is simple and the signal is strong enough to fill my house and even parts of my lawn / driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spaceship router with great features!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to upgrade my wireless router and after many searches and timing, this router fit the build. With dual bands so I can have 2.4 and 5ghz for my many devices I run at home. This router is fast and reliable and comes with great features and an app to control it. I also love having the usb 3.0 on the router to essentially have your own cloud space at home so all my computers can connect to it. Also aesthetically it looks like a space ship, so its no an eye sore like the older routers.
customer_reviews.author: Masato F.

customer_reviews.title: From 88Mbps to 171Mbps
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router used on Amazon. Very easy to install and setup. Firmware update was a breeze. I have Cox as my ISP and was getting 88Mbps via Cat7 Ethernet on my Cisco E1200 router. Now I'm getting 171Mbps. Just to think, I've been paying my ISP for this speed all this time and wasn't even using 1/2 of the bandwidth. As a bonus, my Google Chrome Cast and Amazon Fire TV stick now has a great connection on the other side of my house. The WiFi range is incredible. So glad I bought this router and never looking back.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Paredes

customer_reviews.title: Great product but watch out for the free technical service.
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. easy set up for the novice.. I had only one problem.. My laptop could not connect to the internet. I called the free 90 day technical service only to find out it was not free. Instead of helping the lady from another country spent her time trying to sell me a service plan for $66.00 and $99.00 and a more expensive plan. She did not attempt to help me. I called a friend who helped me over the phone in 5 minutes. I am disappointed with Netgear, they have such a good reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. JWW

customer_reviews.title: Fast router, nightmare  to use.
customer_reviews.text: The router itself is incredibly fast, but forget about logging into the configuration and setting it up. The unit takes about 5 minutes to boot, and even when fully connected to the internet, logging in to the configuration page is a nightmare, about a minute load time per configuration page, if it even loads at all. Requires daily reboots. Wish I could still return it--it's not even compatible with dd-wrt. To those who are thrilled about QOS, even $50 routers from years ago have it. The price in this router comes from the WIFI architecture, with phased array antennas (marketed as beamforming) which selectively generates interference patterns to boost wifi in specific locations.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Does not support NAT loopback.
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for a couple years until I moved a clustered game server to it and found out it does not support NAT loopback (hairpinning) like a lot of other routers (including lower model Netgear routers). I didn't know I needed it until I did, and Netgear let me down. Premium product with important missing feature.
customer_reviews.author: Gamin' Fool

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage and speed.  Decent interface.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well after initial update. I'm not ecstatic about the interface. My past several routers were Linksys and I prefer their interface, though DD-WRT wins by miles. If having external antenna is what it takes to get good coverage within my home, then I will accept that. The coverage and speed is great. Not overly hot either. From an engineering perspective, THANK YOU for providing a switch to turn-off the external LEDs. They are bright and it's great to have that option. It's very much the little things.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Watt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Signal Strength!
customer_reviews.text: Signal is much better than my last router. I have a two story house and I get a signal everywhere in the house, even downstairs in the garage. Netflix and On-demand download without any problems. Netgear Customer Service is excellent. Easy Set Up!
customer_reviews.author: ShellH

customer_reviews.title: The range this gets is unreal
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow the range! I have a pretty wide house on a fair sized lot built in the 70s. Houses this old are a little worse off for RF connectivity. I have this thing in one corner of my house and on the far corner of my lot I still have over half signal on the 5ghz band going through multiple walls and a fireplace being in the way. Has good features and the smartphone app (for android at least) works extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Very fast router
customer_reviews.text: This router is very fast and very reliable. I've had very little issues with it since I bought it. I have a very large library of digital media. The only issue I have with this router is that it does not have enough memory to hold the list of media when the DLNA server goes through the attached USB drive to create a list the music and video on the drive. So, I use Plex as my media server instead as it's more flexible. But just as a router, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: RPLTop Contributor: Amazon Echo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful Router, and very handsome at that. I love watching it intimidate any guest I have visiting my home with its rigid lines and overwhelming presence of sheer Wi-Fi beam-forming power. The Interface in the actual configuration dashboard is as simple or as complex as you want it to be, via the "advanced" menus. My Favorite aspect of it was being able modulate wi-fi strength and have multiple networks for guests and others such things. The most important thing being its ability to get a signal through my previously impenetrable walls. A really great router for anyone who knows what their are doing when customizing their network. Make your network exactly how you want it.
customer_reviews.author: Gerbil

customer_reviews.title: Decent router but over priced
customer_reviews.text: I was having a lot of problems with the router dropping connections and having to reboot but the latest update got rid of most of it. I still have to reboot it sometimes once every week or two. I'm not super impressed with the data transfer speed between my laptop with a USB 3.0 ASUS Wireless AC Adapter to the router with a USB 3.0 Toshiba 1TB drive. I'm seeing no where near the speeds they claim but that could be something I just don't have set up right. All things considered its a decent router but I think I should have gone with one of the top tier ASUS routers with better reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Solid WiFi router
customer_reviews.text: Amazon shipped me V2 a couple of weeks back. I bought Archer AC1200 wifi adapter for my old N wifi laptop and now I get 18 MBytes/s file transfer speed over the WiFi and no dropped connection around a distance of 40-50 feet (I used to get 3 MBytes/s with N-wifi) Very happy with the purchase. I guess V2 has resolved the issues and the infamy of the old version is the reason for the low price deal I got. But AFAIK no DD-WRT or Tomoto firmware so far for this. Also no ready-cloud support for R7500 while the older version has the cloud feature.
customer_reviews.author: TechN

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR Nighthawk X4 AC2350
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Netrgear R6300 V1 in 2013, Jan of 2016, it died, purchased a NETGEAR Nighthawk X4 AC2350 Smart Wi-Fi Router (R7500) to replace it, thought I would upgrade, delievered, could never get it to work correctly, even after spending three hours on the phone with Netgear support. Returned it and purchased a Netgear R6300 V2, seems to be working OK so far, hope it last longer than the v1 did.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router with great functionality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router and nice NAS functionality. Haven't really been able to test out the AC speeds since I don't have an AC adapter yet. I mainly got this because it has a esata port although it will not work with an enclosure with multiple drives but that was mainly me hoping it would. All other features are great haven't really used the guest network much since I don't get many guests.
customer_reviews.author: echomancer

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware that failed me in it's parental controls.
customer_reviews.text: Router is solid nothing against it form that side of the coin. Signal strength was great all over the house so I was very saddened to return it. the Parental controls requires such a convoluted process to block access during time windows or to specific sites was near impossible or so convoluted a process it might as well have been. If you don't need to implement parental controls then this is an awesome router. Once you get kids look at the Asus RT-AC3200 it has almost as many features and granular network controls.
customer_reviews.author: Jack of all trades

customer_reviews.title: Netgear Nighthawk X4
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router from Amazon to try to upgrade my family's internet connection. So far it has been working great! We have multiple Xbox One's in the house and most if not all of them have Open Nat and have excellent download and upload speeds. I am very happy to have a Nighthawk Router.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Good wireless router with ridiculous range
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. The 5G band does appear to have much higher throughput for most of my devices and it's been solidly on since I hooked it up. No need to reboot and such so far. The regular band network reaches to every corner of my house (the main reason I bought it was to eliminate dead spots in the house) so I am exceptionally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: This product failed after 9 months of use. After 2 hours of tech support with netgear (which is a horrible, backwards process), I was able to get a replacement under the 1 year warranty. Hopefully this 2nd units last longer then 9 months. I expected thos router to last longer theb a cheap one for Walmart but it doesn't seem like that is the case.
customer_reviews.author: MB139

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. The hardwire connection to the Xbox 1 has disconnected a couple of times for some unknown reason. Had to reset the router to get it to reconnect. The wireless signal has been good so far and the netgear genie app is handy. The parental controls and bypass accounts are a little disappointing, as they are easy to circumvent and not as customizable as might be expected. I've had it for a month or so, so if it starts to fail I'll update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Mehkc

customer_reviews.title: it started out awesome. Them a few months later it started droping ...
customer_reviews.text: Eh.... it started out awesome. Them a few months later it started droping signal over and over. I did a factory reset that helped. But still not fully reliable. The range is great. I can walk down the block and still pick it up. Though a friend of mine has the same one and his doesnt have the same problems so good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic router for full 2-story house coverage
customer_reviews.text: This router is terrific. I was using Optimum's free wireless router, and there were dead spots within the house, plus I needed to restart the router every once in a while. With this router, sitting on the ground floor towards one end of the house, I'm able to get full coverage - including the far 2nd floor area. Super fast, easy to setup. This router is on the expensive side, but as the backbone of our internet connection, it really performs.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Y

customer_reviews.title: I'm also pleased with the interface for port forwarding
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Netgear WNDR Wireless G/N router with this puppy. The range has almost doubled. I now no longer use a range extender. I'm also pleased with the interface for port forwarding, the network map, etc. I do wish it was a little bit smarter and assigned static IPs automatically when going through the quick network setup wizard. For instance, why would a wireless printer be on a dynamic IP? In any case, the fix was a simple config change so no worries about dropping a star. This thing is fast and reliable. What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: James M Gallina

customer_reviews.title: works great..
customer_reviews.text: Still deciding on whether to warranty it or not. For Wi-Fi...works great...when it works. 5G stopped transmitting after about a week so I stopped connecting to it. Then a week later, the other channel stopped but 5G started working again. As for wired...every once in a while, I lose connection but Wi-Fi is still working. Rebooting tends to fix it but not expecting to baby it every time I want to be online. But when it works....it's fast and distance is good.
customer_reviews.author: YohiSam

customer_reviews.title: They have removed several features like Ready Cloud
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware This is a downgrade from the cheaper and older R7000. They have removed several features like Ready Cloud. So you cannot use it to setup your cloud storage and use it like a Google drive or Dropbox. On the company forums they have confirmed that these were initially planned but then a decision was made to not offer these features. When I pay for extra for a more expensive and latest model, I dont expect it to be a downgrade.
customer_reviews.author: etwret

customer_reviews.title: I made a bad purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It's fine accept for one huge problem. The 5G Wireless WiFi drops out all the time. even when I'm 3 feet away from the R7500 Netgear router with my iPad. Also my Mac Mini only 4 feet away drops out as well. Had to hard wire the Mac Mini to get any usable internet connection through the Netgear router. I do NOT recommend this as a router for home or business use.
customer_reviews.author: Charles N. Gervais

customer_reviews.title: The router was very easy to install and is very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: The router was very easy to install and is very user friendly. You do not need to be tech savy at all to get your router up and running. I can also control all my setting through my computer, which makes changing my password and setting a different name for my wifi so easy. And most importantly the speed of my internet was greatly increased and the range is also quite good. All my devices connect to the internet and are much more fun to use. No video buffering, and downloads are so quick. I really do love this product.
customer_reviews.author: A Olivares

customer_reviews.title: No Brainer!
customer_reviews.text: I'm on Time Warner (30 MBbps) with my own Motorola 6141 modem and this Router. It works really well with great throughput and range. Router speed (86 Mbps) is always higher than my connection speed. Easiest to set up of all the routers I have dealt with through the years. I like the EasyShare program and USB ports I can access from my phone or tablets. Took me all of 20 minutes to setup and secure. Can't say enough how much I like this router.
customer_reviews.author: dwLost

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed with the Software interface
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with the Software interface. I use ASUS router and upgraded to this router thinking about better quality from US manufacturer, but, the GUI is so outdate, No VPN support for Mac OSX. Very bulky VPN support, and very little parental control . I would not recommend this product until it overhall the software GUI.
customer_reviews.author: SengYong

customer_reviews.title: Rarely drops off and the lag time is not too bad. We have 5 laptops
customer_reviews.text: Finally a router that works for our household, We have so many devices connected that we were having trouble finding a router that would support the house. This one so far is doing the trick. Rarely drops off and the lag time is not too bad. We have 5 laptops, 1 smart tv, 2 smart blue ray players, 4 smart phones, xbox 360 and wii connected. We are very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do far it's great!
customer_reviews.text: After (simple) installation, I had a minor issue with my computer connecting, thankfully the FAQ was able to answer my questions and I felt tech savvy for once. I no longer have issues with slow streaming when more than two devices are online, netflix seems to work more clearly and gaming is smoother. Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Allen

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome router i get full coverage in my house on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome router i get full coverage in my house on both 2.4 and 5G bands. as for speeds this thing is a superstar!!!! my internet connection is 300Mbs down by 20Mbs up and i get the full speed to all my wireless devices on the 5G band. the GUI is clean and easy to understand even for a novice. I highly recommend this router to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Pantyhose Heels

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing. Punches through walls and interference like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing. Punches through walls and interference like a champ! I previously had an ASUS 68U and an 87U and this ting kicks both of their butts. The new V2 version is incredible but there is limited support for third party firmware currently so if you want to use OPENWRT or DD-WRT you need to find a V1 model. As for me, I have zero complaints. Cover an entire 3000sq ft home that's' 3 stories without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: It's fast but I don't like the interface...
customer_reviews.text: It's fast. I don't like the interface but the entire industry seams to be going with more pictures and fewer options. If I could get this modern hardware the the text-based UI from 10 years ago, I would be in heaven! Super-power speeds and commercial grade options, now THAT would be a router to write a review on!
customer_reviews.author: Premeditated Trouble

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. I have a house filled with WIFI ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. I have a house filled with WIFI and have been on a three year old Belkin. I now have limitless range and strength for a house utilizing Sonos, Dish TV (Joeys), mulitple lap tops and Desktops, and this nighthawk has been flawless. I really appreciate the software that allows you to get inside the router anytime. The software has many many features you cannot modify inside the usual IP login. Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Selina Hoflund

customer_reviews.title: Great range and power.. and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a great and powerful router. I have 12+ things connected xbox playstation pc etc.. and everyone who lives at my house has thier cell/tablet connected to it. I have the router in my room and it still reaches my brother in laws room that it is litterally on the otherside of the house as far as he could be and i still reach him with over 50 mbps.. fyi my ip only alows 50mbps so that pretty awsome.. so if you need range and power i recomend this bad boy. And the setup was simple as always took 5 to 10 mins to set everything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor wireless connectivity - overpriced and worthless
customer_reviews.text: WiFi signal extremely poor, even when standing next to the router. Weak signal and drops intermittently. Tried changing channels for less interference, but when sitting directly next to the router, the Netgear Genie app's WiFi Analytics function still only reflects -30 dBm (halfway between "Good" and "Best". Save your money and steer clear. Edit: router also drops connection when attached via Ethernet cable only.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hung

customer_reviews.title: This destroys the FiOS router
customer_reviews.text: Figured out how to use this instead of the FiOS Actiontek (no thanks to Verizon of course) and instantly improved my service. Despite paying for 50/50 I was only getting 20/20 on their hardware and struggled to get a reliable connection throughout my house. After switching to this router I am getting 49/53 consistently and I have full wifi coverage in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: It can be great, but the software one must hate.
customer_reviews.text: This is a tough one. I believe this R7500 has the potential to be one of the best routers. The issue? Its buggy. I have tried 3. Yes I said 3 and my downloads speeds dropped 50% from the R7000. I think once the get the firmware worked out it will be awesome. Until then get a R7000. Enough time has passed that they worked the bugs out of it and it gives me awesome speeds and great range.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hamid

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I had been very happy with my previous Nighthawk model and was expecting even better results from this unit. Unfortunately, my "old" Nighthawk performs better than this X4 on just about every level. My AC devices would have constant connection issues and significantly slower throughput than with my old unit. Range was also no better. I have removed this unit and put my old Nighthawk back in. Hopefully, Netgear will eventually release a stable, bug fixing firmware release to make this unit actually usable.
customer_reviews.author: M. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great job on this new router product
customer_reviews.text: Netgear has done it again...Great job on this new router product. Significantly better than my old ASUS AC66U router which I have been using for over a year. R7500 is much better. We are extremely happy with Wi-Fi speeds and especially the coverage. Now I can sit in the back yard and connect my i-Pad, Lenovo laptop using 5 GHz Wi-Fi and get blazing speeds at that distance. With my old router, only 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi count connect over there. Set-up was slower than I would have liked. I like the Genie app. Very intuitive. Kudos to Netgear !!!!
customer_reviews.author: FanOfAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Working with this router has been quite unstable from the ...
customer_reviews.text: Working with this router has been quite unstable from the start, and I tolerated its performance while working endlessly with support to get a mediocre result. As of now, it's been determined I'm receiving a hardware failure where the security setting flip back to default. I think I'm completely done with netgear products in fear of a similar experience for at a hefty price
customer_reviews.author: Rob i

customer_reviews.title: One of the best routers I've had
customer_reviews.text: One of the best routers I've had. Tremendous signal and great throughput. Setting the priority for streaming devices is good. Covers the whole house. I bought the extension antennas for it but haven't installed them yet because it has great coverage. The genie app is nice to make changes without being on a PC.
customer_reviews.author: Jeepowner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router, albeit quite expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Had this since black friday 2015 and so far so good. Not once has it drop any of the devices in my home and it provides constant strong signal. Hopefully it will stay this way. In many respects, this router is overkill for my needs (especially as there are no gamers in my home), but I couldn't pass it up for the price it was offered at on black friday.
customer_reviews.author: Radr

customer_reviews.title: Go big or go home!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a CHAMP! It powers its range over a 2,500 square foot, and provides WiFi coverage over our Acre of land perfectly! So I can mow the lawn and listen to my Pandora, or work in the back garage and watch a YouTube video on how to fix something. Really, go big, or go home with dissapointment!
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: 150/150 service
customer_reviews.text: Had this router for 7 months. Over this period it has become the most unreliable unstable router i have ever used. even after the update that i was told to wait for. Im now back with the verizon router although i lost 40% of my distance at least i have internet now. Netgear was no help in helping me with resolving my issue. One of my favorite networking companies down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Woody S.

customer_reviews.title: This router is great. We went from poor coverage to super coverage ...
customer_reviews.text: This router is great. We went from poor coverage to super coverage even in the yard. Update 12/10/16: The router has died and it is not even 2 years old. Considering the high cost, it definitely should last longer than this. Therefore, I am therefore changing my rating from 5 stars to 2.
customer_reviews.author: tbryant40

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade for multiple users
customer_reviews.text: This router replaced a two router system an n300 & n600 that when combined covered my whole residence. This router works great and even covers my full property inside and out. 4 bedroom ranch style house. 10+ wifi connected devices and a few hardline.
customer_reviews.author: MR AHHSUM

customer_reviews.title: Make a better app.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Wow this thing is awesome! Been using the QOS and with a billion ppl in my house using WiFi I haven't had any problems with sharing Internet. This makes sure my PS4 has all the uninterrupted service I need. Really love how I can go around my house with my phone and check for dead spots. Range is awesome too.
customer_reviews.author: louis wilson

customer_reviews.title: Seems solid. But, firmware isn't great and opensource options not currently available.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. I ding it a star because the firmware isn't very good, especially for a premium device like this. It really should have features competitive with a dd-wrt build at this price. I did purchase this with hopes of flashing a more sophisticated open-source firmware. But, it doesn't look like that has been made compatible for it yet. Not really NETGEAR's fault. It just makes their bad OEM firmware a bigger issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: electronics wizard

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and superb performance. I replaced a Netgear WNDR 3700 with this one and the difference was very notable. The smart wifi chooses what is best for your devices. I also replaced my modem with the Netgear CM500. I can't tell which one made the difference, so I attribute my new performance on both, about 175 Mbps with ethernet, 90-100 on wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Dess

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Doubled the performance from my old n600 router. With this router placed downstairs, I can still get a full signal on the second floor approx. 50' on the opposite end of the house. Eliminated need for extenders. I used Ookla Speedtest and the results are double the throughput.
customer_reviews.author: Tropical Review

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: There is new firmware for this which is rock solid stable yet it's still heavily discounted. If you have devices with multi adapters you may want to avoid. I was in the market for a meh router and got a nighthawk for the same money. 3yr warranty on this
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Savor

customer_reviews.title: Amazing QoS
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to not only upgrade to gigabit, but also heard it has great QoS. I can confirm the QoS is amazing, and well worth the money. I can download a game on one pc, stream netflix on another and not run into bandwidth issues. Super awesome
customer_reviews.author: John E.

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth The Cost!
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years of trying all different types of routers, this one was recommended by a professional. It works incredibly well. I now get a great strong signal all around my house like never before. It looks like a stealth fighter, so that's cool. It's a bit pricey, but so is not having a stable internet connection. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Great if you just want it for wireless use
customer_reviews.text: Great router if you just have wireless devices. If you have wired devices it will not work properly and this is a know issue with Netgear that they cannot fix or will not fix. Very disappointing for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Callista Model

customer_reviews.title: Decent router.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a good router for us. The wifi on this thing is decent, even 2+ rooms away, I have been seeing >300Mb consistently. Router OS could stand some reorganization, but all in all, not a bad choice. Like others have said, the LED's are way bright, but they can be turned off if that bothers you.
customer_reviews.author: Overtkill

customer_reviews.title: Needs reset often
customer_reviews.text: I use this router in my business mainly for our cash register. I have to reset it often as it slows down and stops almost every day during service. Not good when you have line of customers waiting to put their orders in. If anyone has any better resolutions, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Sheldon Simeon

customer_reviews.title: ... renting the cable companies for years (that was $ dumb! )
customer_reviews.text: Should have gotten this years ago - instead of renting the cable companies for years (that was $ dumb!). My techy friend recommended this one and we are still very happy with it six months into it and counting.
customer_reviews.author: McCartin

customer_reviews.title: Plugged it up and it worked!!!
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it up and it worked!!! That may not seem hotly magnificent but a different brand purchased from a local office supply required substantial "configuration" and I couldn't get it to operate. I live in a three bedroom brick home with multiple wifi-enabled devices - printers, notebook computers, smart phones and large televisions. The router seems to deliver our cable broadband signal with ease. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: GT Clifton

customer_reviews.title: Return To Sender
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it was the seller, maybe it was the full moon....who knows. I have set up networks many times, but this was just not grabbing. It absolutely did not work in my home. When I called Netgear the company tech help was very polite, however they recommended in the end that I return it to seller. They said hardware was defective and they apologized.
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Lots of great options and NAS-like feature works very well
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if a firmware will solve it but its throughput is not that impressive. Debating upgrading antennas but am a bit weary as to weather they will 1) work right 2) actually increase range or throughput. Lots of great options and NAS-like feature works very well. But not a racehorse that some might want.
customer_reviews.author: Jared N

customer_reviews.title: I used the Best Buy geeks to install it in combination with NETGEAR ...
customer_reviews.text: I used the Best Buy geeks to install it in combination with NETGEAR Powerline 500 1-Port Starter Kit (XAVB5201). The two together got the Wi-Fi signal extended the whole length of a very long single shotgun house and back through a courtyard to the guest house at the back of the property. Great results!
customer_reviews.author: Hoosier Harmony

customer_reviews.title: watch out for rip-off
customer_reviews.text: Be care for the rip-off. I bought this one half year ago and found my router will lost all its previous setting including any logs after power cycle. When I was looking for help, I found the netgear only have 90 free support, after that, I have to pay for any support So I called the netgear, they asked for a ridiculous price that I can buy another router for software support. I decided not accept that, instead, I can manually re-set the router after each re-boot. Not recommend for anyone if you ever need and manufacturer support. Watch out!
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: I love the fuctionality of this router
customer_reviews.text: I love the fuctionality of this router. I live in an apartment complex where I previously had an issue with bleed over signals from all my neighbors routers causing which often caused me to have connectivity issues. This is no longer an issue and the performance for our laptops, smartphones, Netflix, and online gaming is way better than I anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: GorillaDrummer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent,
customer_reviews.text: Great coverage had this in my house for about 2 months now i have a big family with a lot of data hogs and i can manage good MMO/Online FPS game playing with three people streaming HD Netflix and downloading! also having a harddrive in the usb 3.0 makes great lag free striming from H.D and the last thing is chrome cast works great.
customer_reviews.author: Blazian

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but about once a week it drops the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but about once a week it drops the network drive and i have to reset it. This is a pain because it takes a couple of hours for the router to rescan the network drive for everything to reappear so it can be streamed to other media devices. Other than that it works fine, great signal range, and fast transfer rates.
customer_reviews.author: Don Buffington

customer_reviews.title: ... this for couple of months now and I highly recommend this! Range is excellent and setup is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for couple of months now and I highly recommend this! Range is excellent and setup is a breeze. This router is installed in my basement and I get good signal in my attic using a Netgear AC wireless dongle. I get 5G signal. My technical expertise is an 8 out of 10 on routers.
customer_reviews.author: Batotski

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: easy to set up, but it kept dropping my hard wire internet connection. It's how I'm connected and gives the fastest speed, but let it sit for a few minutes and it's like DSL...it drops off. Wireless works well but it has to be a complete package. Looked everywhere for a fix, but Netgear and other forum suggestions pretty much only addresses wireless which, as I said, was fine. Tried every change in configuration mentioned over the 2 weeks I've had it. I'll give 2-stars as I don't like it, but wireless worked well. Put my WNDR3700 back online and I have had no issues whatsoever. Wireless works, hard wire perfect, so I know it's the device.
customer_reviews.author: Grazoid

customer_reviews.title: One of the best routers out there
customer_reviews.text: Netgear nighthawk in my opinion makes the nest routers out there. I'd buy this again. Had it for nearly 3 years now
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: It never had a good range and very unreliable especially 5ghz
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router on Dec 26,2014. It never had a good range and very unreliable especially 5ghz. A few days ago, 5ghz just stop working completely. I had a netgear n900 which was very reliable. My family really hate me for switching to this model. I am very disappointed such an expensive router had such bad quality.
customer_reviews.author: X CA

customer_reviews.title: Real fast and a lot of features.
customer_reviews.text: I have been real happy with the router. Real fast and a lot of features. The NAS supports TIVO transfers and time machine backups. It is a little expensive but I got it for a good price on a lightning deal. If it was not on sale I would of gone for something a little less expensive. The QOS seems to work well but you will want to disable it if you internet connection is 25 Mbs or better.
customer_reviews.author: Old Geek

customer_reviews.title: I see fantastic speeds. Using this
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but trouble. If I bypass and connect directly to cable modem, I see fantastic speeds. Using this, nothing but trouble.
customer_reviews.author: jazzfan99

customer_reviews.title: It works great but if your internet doesn't have Gig a blast ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great but if your internet doesn't have Gig a blast the device is limited.. we have a PS4 player, smart t.v x 2 and 5 smart phones and when all r active it will crash
customer_reviews.author: hughes

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Started off great, then worked intermittently. Did a Security update to firmware and can no longer access the modem even after a reset No more Netgear for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Gilman

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time in good condition, sets up easily
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time in good condition, sets up easily, and randomly kicks wired connections to the internet but not network. I have tried for weeks now to fix that particular problem with minimal results, meaning I was able to make the time between kicks longer. Wireless connection stays solid and it runs 10 to 14 devices with no problems yet. We have only had it a few months though.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: Never worked right--(slower wireless speed than with my old Lyksys ...
customer_reviews.text: Never worked right--(slower wireless speed than with my old Lyksys router). Spent hours on the phone with the NetGear tech people trying to get it to work. Rather than offer to send me a replacement A.S.A.P., with a pre-paid shipping label to return the defective router, they stated that I should return it to Amazon since for them to send me a replacement would take "a long time." I opted for a refund from Amazon since to get a replacement from them would have taken almost two months.
customer_reviews.author: LARRY ROBERT JONES

customer_reviews.title: Worse -- after about a year
customer_reviews.text: We really didn't find this to be any faster than the one we had purchased 5 years earlier. Worse -- after about a year, it stopped working and since it was no longer covered under the warranty, we were screwed.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Harvie

customer_reviews.title: Good at first, now bad.
customer_reviews.text: After less than two years this router no longer keeps its settings in the event of power loss. At first I used this device as my router, but its shortcomings rapidly became apparent. Now using it in AP mode, which it's good that it comes with, but it tries to be too helpful, making it difficult to set up again after every time it loses its settings. To add insult to injury, it won't even properly reconfigure itself when restored from settings backup. Netgear's quality control is very poor.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Definitely extends coverage throughout my apartment better than Time Warner
customer_reviews.text: I have FTTH and had to get a new router to keep up with the data. It's huge, but it works well. Definitely extends coverage throughout my apartment better than Time Warner. I'd recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: MMY

customer_reviews.title: I messed with a number of other brands that supposedly had great specs and features but wound up having problem after ...
customer_reviews.text: Nighthawk is the way to go if you are going to buy a router. I messed with a number of other brands that supposedly had great specs and features but wound up having problem after problem. They were more trouble than they were worth. My Nighthawk is trouble free and offers great speeds all over the house.
customer_reviews.author: David Hinz

customer_reviews.title: yup
customer_reviews.text: I'm running an entire concert through this thing. Multiple devices. about 4 times per week. Easy setup. Easy interface. You might want to put some masking tape over the LED lights. They will light up your neighborhood. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 Ghz still works fine but 2
customer_reviews.text: It has worked for some time but suddenly a firmware update broke 2.4. 5 Ghz still works fine but 2.4 is broken. I guess I could go back to the older firmware but that has security holes.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Nice router
customer_reviews.text: Hooked this up on Friday to the CM500 modem. My ISP is TWC Ultimate 300mbps. Wired I get 340 down and 24 up. Wireless in a bedroom I get 170 down and 20 up. I have 3 samrt tv, direct tv, a security system, 4 phones, 3 tablets, xbox1, Nintendo 3ds, and 4 laptops. 4 bedroom, 2500 sq ft house. So far no drops like when I used the twc Ubee supplied combo. the genis app is a little basic but useable and the dynamic QoS is not a big deal for me. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Scott Mellon

customer_reviews.title: Definitely one of the best
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful router super fast love this thing, easy to set up can be controlled from a smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Grant D. Hammond

customer_reviews.title: This is a great unit, very powerful
customer_reviews.text: After my LYNKSYS quit after 14 months, I've gone with NETGEAR now. 6 weeks and counting so far.This is a great unit ,very powerful, Covers my 1800 sq ft ranch and 3 car garage with "very strong - strong signal" . Love the Netgear Genie app for Android.
customer_reviews.author: 4MRAV8R

product_meta.title: NETGEAR R7500 Nighthawk X4 AC2350 Dual Band WiFi Router ((Discontinued)
product_meta.description:
Style:RouterThe Nighthawk X4 AC2350 Smart WiFi Router is the next wave in WiFi. Quad-Stream X4 Architecture delivers speeds up to 2.35Gbps and the 1.4GHz dual core processor and Dynamic QoS, give you unparalleled performance for gaming and streaming. Twin USB 3.0 and an eSATA port provide fast access to high-capacity external storage.

Package Contents

- Nighthawk X4 AC2350 Smart WiFi Router (R7500)
- Four (4) detachable antennas
- Ethernet cable
- Quick install guide
- Power adapter

Minimum System Requirements

- Microsoft 8,7, Vista, XP, 2000, Mac OS, UNIX, or Linux
- Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0, Firefox 2.0, Safari 1.4, or Google Chrome 11.0 browsers or higher

Technical Specifications

- Model #: R7500-100NAS
- AC2350 (600Mbps @ 2.4GHz – 256 QAM support + 1733 Mbps @ 5GHz 11ac)
- Powerful Dual-Core 1.4GHz processor
- Two (2) USB 3.0 ports
- One (1) eSATA port
- Four (4) high-performance external antennas
- Five (5) 10/100/1000 Mbps Gigabit Ethernet ports (1 WAN & 4 LAN)


AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Quad-Stream AC2350 WiFi - up to 2.33Gbps (600 + 1733 Mbps)
Next generation Wave 2 WiFi.Denial-of-service (DoS) attack prevention
Dynamic QoS bandwidth prioritization by application
Twin USB 3.0 and eSATA ports for external storage
Four high-performance external antennas and Beamforming+ for maximum range
Manage your home network with NETGEAR genie

Fastest available 1.4GHz dual core processor.System Requirements:Microsoft Windows 7,8,Vista,XP 2000,Mac OS,UNIX or Linux,Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0,Firefox 2.0,Safari 1.4 or Google Chrome11.0 browsers or higher

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars642 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
